title: Responsive design with Bootstrap
author: Liis U
description: Responsive web design (RWD) is a web design approach how to make webpages and applications look good on all screen sizes, on mobile, desktop, or any other. It isn't technology, it's an approach. Bootstrap is the most popular framework for developing responsive and good-looking websites using a this design approach. It's an open-source front-end development framework that has pre-built CSS and JavaScript components for fast applicable design. Once you have your project started, there are several ways to include Bootstrap in the project. When included, you simply copy-paste the code from the website and modify it just by adding some classes to the elements. In the same manner, the default colors and styles can be overwritten (if installed through the node package manager, there are more options and ways to change). Bootstrap key features include the use of a grid system to make it more flexible and give developers the freedom to adjust their site the way they want it. The grid system is based on the breakpoints, which are the sizes different device screens should be, from desktop to tablet to phone screen size. It offers responsive CSS classes where one can simply add class=button btn-primary and the button has a style and look to it. Bootstrap avoids developers from writing a lot of (CSS) code and makes applying style easier and faster. And Bootstrap has many built-in components, like cards, navigations, and much more. In general, Bootstrap has made it easier to make great-looking websites, it has a slight learning curve, but once the idea behind it is clear it is easy to apply great styles to your projects.

title: HTML - an introduction
author: Liis U
description: HTML is short for Hyper-Text Markup Language, which gives a structure to the web, a markup language that defines how to display the content with the help of its elements. HTML is the most basic building block, it specifically is meant to give structure, not beauty nor interactivity to the site, the 'beauty' comes from CSS and JS addition to the code or project. All three of them go hand in hand when building a website, usually, you wouldn't see one without another. According to Wikipedia, HTML was first released in 1993 by Tim Berners-Lee and is now a 30-year-old language. Since then, versions have gone through a lot of change and currently, there is a 5th version we are using. HTML document has a head where all the metadata goes about the page that is necessary for the browsers, like the version of HTML, CSS links, and all other data for proper loading. The body carries elements that give the page the actual content that we see in our browsers. Elements like <img/> which helps us to include images, <p></p> add paragraphs, and <h1></h1> to add a heading. Of course, there is a lot more and elements are quite specific and easy to understand, where they should go, like the footer, header, nav, and so on. HTML is usually not considered a programming language but rather a markup language, because it lacks variables, conditional statements, and other programming-specific syntax and behavior. Overall, HTML is an essential technology for web development and is the foundation and basis for all applications and web pages online. For a front-end developer, this is definitely an essential and elementary tool to have in the toolbox.

title: CSS - an introduction
author: Liis U
description: CSS is short for Cascading Style Sheet, which is a stylesheet language that is used to describe how a page should look like, how elements should be rendered on screen, on paper, when printed, etc. CSS's initial release was in 1996, so already 26 years of making our websites look nice. CSS doesn't just work on its own, CSS styles pages written in HTML and other markup languages. We can give an element group (class=className), singe id (id=singleId) a name or just style the element itself without naming it( a { color: green } - all links ), but this can be very confusing later, trying to understand your own or other people's code. Luckily, CSS also allows code commenting, in cases like complicated styling, so that added comments can make things more understandable. Usually, people start learning HTML first and CSS shortly after, as you need to have a structure to style that HTML creates. Just like HTML, CSS also is not considered a programming language because it is meant for styling. It's lacking programming language properties, but can be equally challenging when learning it, like the forever question: how to center a div :). When building websites it's great to use a live server that compiles the code and you see the result immediately in front of your eyes, also with the help of the developer's tool element tab, it's easy to see what and how to change. It's a great help as you can do the change on your browser without affecting your real styles, and if it looks good then apply it actually. Overall, CSS is a powerful language that provides a wide range of ways to make a site look fabulous.

title: JavaScript - an introduction
author: Liis U
description: JavaScript (also called JS) is one of the most known and popular programming languages out there. Aside from being able to use it in the front end, JavaScript is also used in the backend for server-side scripting, in desktop and, mobile applications, and even in game development. It is considered the language of the web. It was created to add interactivity and dynamic functionality to the websites. JavaScript is an interpreted language, which means that the code is directly executed, and if there is an error it stops running when it reaches the error. The language is also lightweight and quite easy to learn. It is a loosely typed dynamic language. Loosely typed, because with JavaScript one can do many things, which is not possible to do in other programming languages, like for example in Java. Here it is possible to redeclare variables (var only, also not recommend using anymore, now 'let' and 'const' should be used) and change data types, among many other things. For example: let a = 10; a = 'Hello'; Some of the key features of JS are, that it is event-driven and allows developers to create scripts that respond to actions from users and events on pages. Dynamic typing, where variables don't have to have a specific datatype and can be dynamically changed during run time. And JS supports object-oriented and functional programming. Overall, it is very powerful and versatile, and essential for web development. It is very easy to start learning JavaScript, aside from other languages, with JS nothing is needed to download, simply open the web browser and console in developer tools and simply start writing.
